reviews.text: Good service and value

I love the atmosphere here, feels very private. Service is excellent and food is always amazing.
Best Ramen so far
The food was super yummy and it tasted good and tasty
The ramen is fantastic, the flavor is special
I always order combo A, my favoriteüòçüòç
Un excelente ramen con una un ambiente brutal.
The service is quick and awesome. The food is really good with a lot of favor! Definitely should go with friends and family!
The atmosphere is very private. Really good environment. Food tastes amazing. Really good place. I would recommend this place.
The food is really good and service is quick. Definitely should come again!!
Good!
Great food. Good atmosphere.

The waiter brought us to a room with extremely dim lighting and when we asked to change it she refused. Not only that we waited 20 min to get served and afterwards another 28 min for them to bring us the check. There was a total of three other customers and they couldn‚Äôt switch a room for us ? And that curtains was broken too.
10/10 I would recommend trying this place out!!!
The  food here is so good
Ramen was fantastic for the price. Thai ice tea was great. Service waa friendly and fast.
The food looks and tastes very good. The people also gave really good service and always spoke with a nice tone. The atmosphere is really traditional down to the dishes. Would definitely come back !
The food was looked very appetizing and was really yummy. The service was relatively fast and the atmosphere was nice. I would definitely come back again!!
kid friendly, good food, attentive service, and a friendly atmosphere! Would come back again
So good! Food was amazing (this time I got the honeycomb platter), service friendly, extremely timely. Ambience was perfect!
Very filling and very tasty
i love their thai tea the food come fast and quick easy for a quick bite if food super affordable
Good food! My favorite ramen evaaaaa! Love the spicy ramen. I‚Äôve tried the popcorn chicken before, it‚Äôs really good. The omurice is also good with the Demi glace ü´∂ 10/10!
The food was excellent 10/10.
Great food, nice waiters.
it was a real peaceful atmosphere. the place played enjoyable music. i really enjoyed the privacy with the booths.
Food excellent
Service and food were excellent
Wonderful experience. The food was amazing as well as the server.
Overall great experience, love the food and service!
Nice atmosphere, good food , life‚Äôs good
This location is great, more quieter than the other. Staffs are great. And most especially, it‚Äôs convenient to get to on the no.7 train.
My family has been here several times.  Food is always delicious and has great service.

Fuimos a comer en lunch, us√© el ba√±o de arriba y no hab√≠a jab√≥n ni papel ni para secarse las manos. Le informamos a la host sobre la falta de elementos de higiene en el ba√±o y al parecer no le import√≥, sigui√≥ ocupada en su tel√©fono y en ning√∫n momento subi√≥ a verificar o a abastecer el ba√±o. No volveremos.
Standard experience every time, delicious food. Excited to see that they‚Äôre expanding their menu.

The food deserves 4 stars. However, the service is really hard to rate.
The attitude is bad, the water glass is never refilled when it is empty.
The server always hiding her head at the service station.
If you want to get a check or swipe a card, you have to ring the bell to call her.
The most exaggerated thing is that they have small sharing plates on the table. When the previous table of guests leaves, the guests just put the plate aside and don‚Äôt use the plate. The service staff will not replace it with a new one and save it for the next table of guests. So, if you go there to eat, try not to use those sharing plates.
Good ramen, we had the combo meal for 2, the noodles are a great texture
Service was on point, the food has been better in other locations.
Good food, pretty affordable ramen!
ÏπòÌÇ®ÏÜåÏú†ÎùºÎ©ò ÎßõÏûàÏñ¥Ïöî ^_^

There are two types of people in this world. Those that eat ramen and those that eat Top Ramen.

If youre an avid ramen enthusiast and go out of their way to find a good bowl of ramen, this is worth a skip. As I believe you will not be impressed.  If this is your first time trying something outside of a package or you are trying to introduce your friends to ramen, this place is worth trying.

There are a number of locations around New York City, this particular one in Flushing is a bit tucked away. They have very attractive combo sets and enough of a selection (even vegetarian) that there will be something for everyone. Excluding their vegetarian ramen, they serve Tonkotsu and Shoyu broths with variations that include spicy miso. Their noodles are wavy instead of straight so if you like that little extra bounce with your noodles it is a plus.

They have a reward system where at the bottom of the bowl (once you finish your soup) you can be rewarded with either a free drink, popcorn chicken, dessert, and one other (i forgot) on your next visit. I think it is a rather fun and clever way to make sure you return!

Food was prompt, fresh, and delicious.

Popcorn chicken - crispy and tender
Fish seasoned Fries - seamless and crunchy
Sauce - the cherry on top!
Curry Ramen - rich broth, meat was juicy, and noodles had the right texture to soak the flavor

Staff were professional, and the atmosphere is reminiscent of a genuine restaurant from the region bearing its origin

Would definitely come back!

We, 3 adults and 2 kids, all liked our ramens! The noodle and soup were very well balanced. The dish would had been better if the braised porks were warm in the soup. (I understand the egg being a little cold.)

The service was okay, but it was very hot and noisy sitting right next to the kitchen.

Had early dinner here before going to the concert at Citifield. Food was good but service was terrible. Every table has a bell to call the waiter. We pressed the bell and nobody came. 30min later, out of the blue, a waiter shows up and yells: what do you want?
Very rude. Then we were ready to leave so we pressed the bell to get the bill. Nobody. We pressed a second time and still nobody. I had to go see someone at the counter for someone to come. Really not impressed with this place.

We walk in and are immediately greeted & seated promptly. The space is clean, well organized and very cool especially in the summer. The food is amazing, so flavorful and delivered steaming straight off the stove. My go to ramen spot.

Food was good. Service was meh. Took them a long time to seat us despite there being empty tables. They said 15 mins but it took more than half an hour. Took a while to take our order and took another long time to get the bill. We had to leave our table after hitting the call button 30 mins ago (at the inner room) and talk to someone outside. But despite all this the food was decent.
Everything about this place in Queens, New York was marvelous. The service, the food, the portions, the flavor, the place. I will definetely go back for their sweet potato fries and delicious ramen.

Found this on Google Review so why not try and man is this food one of the best Asian cuisine I‚Äôve ever tasted! Service was fast around 5 minutes. The pork rice and takoyaki went so well together, you will not regret! Our total for this place was 34 dollars which anywhere else it would‚Äôve been in around 50-60. Will go again when citifield has a concert soon!

I ordered a takeout with Yakitori Platter (5 Skewers) and the lady told me that there are 5 different Skewers, but when I came home and opened the box there were only 2 Zucchini Skewer inside??? for $16????? The other foods were packed perfectly but I don‚Äôt know if they checked the order correctly while packing????

The atmosphere was ok for the place I notice that‚Äôs some chairs at some tables didn‚Äôt match but the service was terrible. My gf set a reservation for us but we arrived a bit earlier so she asked if it was ok for us to be seated earlier since we were there and the lady at the front seemed very confused and mind you the store was empty so it shouldn‚Äôt be a problem for us to be seated early but aside from that the young server boy didnt even give a hello he just tossed the menu on the table and walked off. When he finally came to get our orders he didn‚Äôt even confirm anything we were saying about our orders or even say ‚Äúare you ready to take your orders?‚Äù. On top of all of this it took him forever simply to bring me a glass of water, didn‚Äôt get my dessert with my omurice and a HAIR strand was in my gfs ramen. Very unsanitary and the staff need to learn courtesy and proper customer service

Simply put, this is a great ramen spot, serving comforting, well-executed, and deeply satisfying bowls of ramen. The broth was rich, the noodles perfectly cooked, and the flavors well-balanced. But what truly impressed was the creativity of the appetizers. The Purple Sweet Potato Fries with spicy mayo were a unique and delicious starter, the Chilled Tofu had an authentic Japanese street-food feel, and the Salt & Pepper Crispy Corn was a bold, unexpected twist.

The ambiance was just as inviting, with traditional Japanese decor that made it feel like a cozy ramen shop in Ginza or Osaka. The only downside was the service, which was inattentive and not very knowledgeable. However, the outstanding food and atmosphere more than made up for it.

We just randomly went here to eat some authentic Ramen and Japanese food. The food was extremely good and delicious, I applaud the chef of this store. Truly when it comes for a good food trip NYC is one of the best to go.

It‚Äôs just the service extremely sucks as well. That‚Äôs why I gave 3star rating. For how good the food was, the service was the total opposites. Server seems doesn‚Äôt seem like what his doing, don‚Äôt care about his customers and not courteous nor polite. When you ask a questions it seems like his too bothered to even answer.

I really don‚Äôt want to even leave a tip, I just did because of the great food. I wish I can choose where my tip will go, for kitchen staff.

Overall still recommended because the food was really delicious. Just do not expect anything with their customer service it was so outrageous.

We absolutely love Kyuramen in Flushing! This is our second visit, and it has become our go-to spot for Japanese food in Queens. We appreciate that they always welcome us and our service dog, letting us sit in their cozy private area. The food is consistently fresh and delicious, and Combo B is a fantastic choice! It comes with two ramen bowls, two desserts, two drinks, and popcorn chicken ‚Äì perfect for sharing. Highly recommend this branch for its friendly service and great atmosphere. We‚Äôll definitely be back again! üçú

The atmosphere resembles an authentic experience with calming music along with mood lighting and plants. The food is really good and you can get full really fast. Good place to go if you're starving and if you're craving noodles and a variety of other appetizers.

We had a group of people here for the 1st time. Service was terrible, one there was a table available for about 15min but they just didn't care letting us in more than their chatters. No body served water and we had to ask for a cup of water? I mean, c'mon guys.

Food platters was amazing, but Scramble egg over rice was way overated. Just a bland rice with bland scrambled eggs. Nothing special, not worth the price. Ramen was on the saltier side. Overall not recommended and don't think we'd pay another visit.

Kyuramen is our go to spot whenever we‚Äôre in Flushing. I ordered the white garlic Tokyo Tonkotsu Shouyu ramen. It was excellent, full of flavor and finished down to the last slurp. I also got the Thai iced tea, which is always a reliable favorite. I was part of a group of 5. Three people ordered Sapporo Miso Ramen with varying levels of spiciness. One person got the popcorn chicken. Since they are a child it was the perfect portion for them.
As far as service is concerned, the waiter was very nice and got whatever we needed quickly. We were there on a weekday afternoon so we were the only people upstairs. I could see if it is crowded why you would need the call button at the table. We only used it to get the bill. I‚Äôm sure we will return to Kyuramen.

I could not come here last time as there was a long wait time, but I was able to get a table on my 2nd attempt. The food are delicious and the waitress was polite and helpful. We ordered a combo set and omurice. The demi-glace was suggest for the omurice since it was sweeter, but the waitress also claims the curry sauce was just as good. The noodles had good flavor, especially the spicy Miso Ramen. If you are not a fan of spicy food, do not worry since the spice level can be adjusted. The desserts were also sweet and beautiful looking! My advice is to plan your arrival since it could be crowded and there may be a long wait time.

I loved this place!! I visited with my best friend and we had a great time. We went around noon on a Sunday and they gave us a booth! It was clean and the food was super delicious and the price was reasonable for the portion. I had to get extra noodles since they were that good. Make sure to visit if you are ever in flushing! It is right next door to Tangram!

We we‚Äôre in a little booth and it was really cozy and intimate. We tasted the ramen soup #1-2 and 3. They we‚Äôre all so good. We‚Äôll definitely come back when in Nyc. We had Ben as our server and he was so nice and we received our plate in less than 5 minutes. I highly recommend this place!

Came here on a Sunday afternoon and there was no wait. Overall I love the experience in Kyuramen. Food was amazing and of course their thai iced tea is so good. Would recommend coming for a simple lunch date. def coming back.
First time I‚Äôve been here! Excellent service and the food was so delicious, definitely worth the visit. I got the tonkotsu ramen and popcorn chicken it was warm and filling!

Terrible service, one of the worst my family and I have experienced. From the very beginning, the young lady who led us to our table looked like she didn‚Äôt want to be there.

We were not asked what we would like to drink. When we finally got our drinks, it was served after the food. Nobody came to check on us. We had to use the call button to ask them to serve our dessert that came with the meal. The young server did not clear our dishes before serving dessert even though I asked him too.

The food was good and the atmosphere was pleasant, but we will not return due to such ridiculous service. There was not a single smile given from any of the severs there.
Ambiance and service are good. Ramen noodles tastes little hard and soup was tasty.

I'm on a mission to explore the different Kyu Ramen locations. This was my first time at the Flushing location. It was not difficult to locate. The interior design is definitely captivating when you first walk in. The wooden aesthetic is different. The stairs that lead up to the dining area are kinda steep. The upstairs dining area has a decent amount of tables and are spaced out. The first floor has a bar btw. The waiters/waitresses are very polite and attentive. They make sure your glass is full of water and that you don't have empty plates or bowls on your table for too long. I wanted to try new menu items; he lobster chashu balls were an acquired taste. I feel like they tasted good, just for me personally I had just the one and that was enough. My boyfriend had the chicken ramen, popcorn chicken and gyoza, he really enjoyed the gyoza and the popcorn chicken especially. He enjoyed the ramen noodles themselves. I had the ying-yang bowl which was new, a taste of tonkatsu and miso. I preferred the tonkatsu side, but both broths had their own distinguished flavors. The noodles were nice and chewy and the additives were a nice temperature. Overall, I may not have finished everything, but I'm very certain that others with a different palate from mine would enjoy every bite. I still enjoyed my time here and I look forward to trying other locations.
Love the style of the place. Food is not bad. Service was on point.

I usually go for the ramen which is amazing here but this visit I wanted to try something different and it was soooooo good. I ordered the Tonkatsu Omurice Fluffy omelet. It‚Äôs eggs and Pork Tonkatsu on top of chicken fried rice, topped with Curry Sauce. The lemonade was good also.

Customer service was up to expectations. Presentation of food is satisfactory. The atmosphere and ambience is authentic and comfortable. There are plentiful seating options at the bar or in booths. We ordered side dishes, ramen, and curry omurice. All very delicious. Note: the highest level of spice for ramen broth is less spicy than buldak instant ramen. Two servings of matcha pudding tasted rather strange. It could be a coincidence. The cherry blossom pudding are adeptly sweetened. Overall experience was good.

Today was my first visit. I came with high expectations, hoping to enjoy a proper omelette in Flushing. The atmosphere was pleasant, and the delicious aroma heightened my anticipation. However, from the moment I sat down, my excitement turned into disappointment.

The servers guided me to the second floor and left me unattended for 15 minutes. It wasn‚Äôt until much later that they took my order, and even then, water was never served until after my food arrived.

The plating of the pork cutlet omelette was unremarkable. The servers couldn‚Äôt even cut the omelette properly, so it spilled over the side. Is it the standard here to plate the pork cutlet on the side and pour the sauce on it instead of placing it on top of the omelette? That‚Äôs fine, I suppose. But the fried rice inside the omelette was cold and greasy, and it was so overly salty that it was inedible unless eaten with the egg. The pork cutlet wasn‚Äôt fried properly, leaving me with a raw batter-like texture.

I won‚Äôt be coming back. Even after finishing my meal, I was left without service for another 20 minutes, and I still never received water. Please train your servers properly. It felt like no effort was made. They don‚Äôt even seem to know what they‚Äôre supposed to be serving. Do not go here‚Äîit‚Äôll only ruin your meal.

Un lugar peque√±o y  muy acogedor, tiene un ambiente tranquilo, la comida deliciosa, ordenamos varios platos y realmente todo estaba exquisito.
El servicio de nuestro mesero fue excelente.

Ordered a bowl for myself after work, was pleasantly surprised with the Spicy Ramen! Broth was rich with flavor but not overpowering, and noodles were cooked nicely.
The environment is decorated quite nicely, and gave off a very calm, relaxing environment.
Overall, I would return in the future to try everything else they offer!

Good food! The staff were nice and friendly with good separate seating. Prices were reasonable, and the only thing that would make a difference is if they had added more meat into the ramen bowls. I ordered number 9, the original chicken ramen bowl. Very flavorful with tender chicken and two types of seaweed. Overall, I would recommend people to come with their friends or partners and enjoy their food. üòä
Service was definately superior prior to the remodeling but the ramen is still the best in the region. I would come back again and again for yin-yang alone, you truly get the best of both worlds.
